===Etymology===
From {{lang|zh|但見時光流似箭}} ("surely time and tide flow like an arrow"), as versed by {{w|Wei Zhuang}} ({{w|Tang Dynasty}}, c. 836-910) in his poem {{lang|zh|關河道中}}:

: {{lang|zh|槐陌蟬聲柳市風, 驛樓高倚夕陽東。}}
: {{lang|zh|往來千里路長在, 聚散十年人不同。}}
: {{lang|zh|但見時光流似箭, 豈知天道曲如弓。}}
: {{lang|zh|平生志業匡堯舜, 又擬滄浪學釣翁。}}

===Proverb===
{{zh-proverb}}

# [[time flies]] like an arrow (''literally'', "time and tide are like an arrow").
#: {{zh-x|都 知 光陰似箭，我 捱過 這 天，我 過 到 這 天，明日 又 有 挑戰。|I know that '''time flies like an arrow'''. [Even if] I suffer through this day, [and if] I can get through this day, tomorrow will still be challenging.|C-LIT|ref={{w2|zh|吳若希}}, {{lang|zh|第一天失戀}}}}
